main.name: Michelle Austin
main.bio: I've been working in the software industry since 2012 as a Technical Project Manager and Business Analyst. In 2018 I learned to code and fell in love with machine learning. Professionally, my interests lie in deep learning, computer vision and improving the world through better software. When I'm not learning something new about computers, I love exploring London, practicing yoga and working on digital art projects.
main.contactmessage: I'd love to hear from you!

resume.skillmessage: Always learning! Check out my progress so far:

work.title: Technical Project Manager
work.description: Wearer of many hats, notably: program management for Cisco Global Events software migration, solution architecture, managing vendor integrations.

work.title: Senior Project Manager
work.description: Managing software build, implementation, and onsite execution of large corporate technology conferences.

work.title: Business Analyst
work.description: Working with clients and internal devleopment teams to configure and build custom software solutions for large corporate technology conferences (1.5k-30k attendees).

publications.title: Entrepreneurial Role-Model Exposure, Self-Efficacy, and Women's Entrepreneurial Intentions
publications.authors: Michelle J. Austin & Margaret M. Nauta

projects.title: Smirkspace

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
